pullRequest.body: These are some minor changes, which are think are positive or neutral in any case, that help Mathlib compile under `set_option debug.byAsSorry true` (an option that [arrived](https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/4576) in v4.10 that turns all `by` blocks into sorries --- Mathlib is very much broken, although perhaps less than one might expect).

nodes.body:

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`++-- image_upperBounds_subset_upperBounds_image`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

:v: semorrison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Can you explain in the PR description what `debug.byAsSorry` is? I assume there's a Lean issue or PR you could link to.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10047417389/job/27769080442)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10047417389/job/27769081161)

Thanks for the clean-up! I agree that these changes are neutral or positive. I left a couple of small tweaks, but in my eyes, this PR could be delegated easily. Hence, let me
maintainer merge
bors d+

Thanks for the clean-up! I agree that these changes are neutral or positive. I left a couple of small tweaks, but in my eyes, this PR could be delegated easily. Hence, let me
maintainer merge
bors d+

```suggestion
theorem dvd_mul_left (hu : IsUnit u) : a âˆ£ u * b â†” a âˆ£ b := by
Just flagging for the other reviewers: I don't have an opinion on these - I trust you these are necessary later.

This change is harmless, but I don't understand why it is needed.

Clearly the `_` is being populated by elaborating the `rfl` proof, but why is this impacted by whether the `rfl` proof is inlined or inserted automatically behind the scenes?
Under `byAsSorry`, `rfl` will never even run.
Oh, is the difference here `by rfl` vs `rfl`?

Does this work?
```suggestion
  { eq_zero_or_eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero := fun {a b} H â†¦
Definitely an improvement, thanks!

I thought mathlib style is to leave a blank line after sections? Not a blocking concern, in any case.
```suggestion
section FoldlEqFoldr

```
Can you update this comment as well?
There's no need to update: the proofs are still there and will generate side goals when rewriting. All that has changed is I've written the types of the proofs.
Perhaps a follow-up question: did you also mean to delete the `(Hf : MonotoneOn f t)` in the variables declaration 17 lines up?

No, that needs to stay: most of the theorems here pick this up in term mode, I've just added to the places that only pick it up from tactic mode.

This may all need revisiting after #2452 is resolved.
Same question: delete the `gc` hypothesis 31 lines above?
As above.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: robustifying for debug.byAsSorry
